description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

🤩 Why is your role important?

As Qovery’s first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You’ll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

🚀 What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery’s value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery’s Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you’ll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

💡 About you

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here’s What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS — ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder’s mindset — you’ve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you’re eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills — you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious — you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature — you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive — in a small team, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

🎯 What You’ll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

💥 Our Talent Acquisition Process

We’ve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery’s values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We’re committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

The full-remote option is accepted only if you reside in a country where the company has a legal entity.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games, while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the largest and most successful hybrid publisher in the world.

Voodoo is creating a small experimentation team with a big mission: find the next best way to entertain the world by taking our best hits to a new level.

You will be one of the first members in a team of six and you will participate in every aspect of development, from ideation to testing the casual games in the market.

Role

Build your team and ensure that your team reaches their goalsLead, inspire and motivate the teams working on the games, and maintain enthusiasm for the projectImprove continuously the internal process of game creationPush updates with gameplay, meta-features and monetisation AB tests at a high paceFollow and improve Voodoo’s management guidelines and onboarding processesManage your team’s HR in order to keep only A players and help them to growShare your knowledge company-wide and help others grow their skillsMonitor and improve game metrics Be involved in all aspects of game development: UI, UX, game design, technical

Profile

Strong analytical skills and are detail and data-orientedPassion for mobile gamesExcellent communication, organization, execution skillsGood game UX knowledge,Mobile F2P market experiences, track record with a successful mobile gameSpeak and write EnglishUnderstanding of game design

Benefits

Best in Class compensationOther benefits according to the country you reside.

Global Enterprise Partners is looking for a Product Content Expert to lead and evolve product content practices within the WeShare Back Office platform. This role is key to managing business needs, driving data quality, and building a strong product content community across regions.Requirements for Product Content Expert role:Proven experience managing product content in digital platforms (e.g., WeShare).Strong understanding of data governance, validation loops, and content lifecycle.Ability to collect, prioritize, and document business needs effectively.Experience supporting transformation projects and E2E content initiatives.Skilled in stakeholder collaboration and cross-functional coordination.Ability to train users, maintain functional documentation, and support tool improvements.Proactive in identifying bugs, improving data processes, and ensuring compliance with standards.Details Product Content Expert Role:Start Date: SeptemberHours per week: 40 hoursDuration: 6+ Months (multiyear project)Location: RemoteType of contract: FreelancerCompensation: Open, please share your expectationsInterested? If you, or somebody else you know could be interested in the above position, please apply directly via the link and/or get in touch with Angelos Gkelmpesis via email a.gkelmpesis(a)globalenterprisepartners.com

description.text:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

At Revolut, we do Ops differently. Our hyper-talented operations experts don’t just keep things ticking over. They’re given the most complex, hard-to-solve problems in the business. Then they create elegant, scalable solutions that keep pace with our ambitious growth plans.

We're looking for a Lead Product Strategy & Operations Manager to help us solve the toughest problems in our global fintech. Someone to roll up their sleeves and dive into every area of our business to help millions of customers worldwide.

Watch this video from our team members about what goes into being a Strategy & Operations Manager at Revolut. If you want to gain unparalleled experience at a leading fintech company, let’s get in touch.

What You'll Be Doing

Optimising scalable processes to support operational efficiency in Western EuropeLeading and executing core infrastructure projectsExploring and defining project priorities for the teamSetting timelines to reach goals efficientlyIdentifying opportunities to improve existing featuresProposing new features to address customer needsManaging critical vendor relationships to ensure service qualityBuilding systems to track vendor performance metricsDeveloping strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiating commercial terms

What You'll Need

A 2:1 degree or higher in a relevant field5+ years of work experience in a fast-paced environmentProficiency in coding with SQL, Python, or RA solid track record of taking ownership and leading complex projects end to endAn analytical mindset to deconstruct complex problemsExperience working with data-driven solutionsA proactive mindset with a focus on delivering data-driven impactExperience in presenting to C-Suite executivesAn interest in the financial industryLeadership capabilities

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Optimising scalable processes to support operational efficiency in Western EuropeLeading and executing core infrastructure projectsExploring and defining project priorities for the teamSetting timelines to reach goals efficientlyIdentifying opportunities to improve existing featuresProposing new features to address customer needsManaging critical vendor relationships to ensure service qualityBuilding systems to track vendor performance metricsDeveloping strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiating commercial terms

What You'll Need

A 2:1 degree or higher in a relevant field5+ years of work experience in a fast-paced environmentProficiency in coding with SQL, Python, or RA solid track record of taking ownership and leading complex projects end to endAn analytical mindset to deconstruct complex problemsExperience working with data-driven solutionsA proactive mindset with a focus on delivering data-driven impactExperience in presenting to C-Suite executivesAn interest in the financial industryLeadership capabilities

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

basic_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)

description.text:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams—including Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing—to rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA’s strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

description.text:
At Matter Labs, we believe freedom drives progress and prosperity. We don’t see ourselves as a company, but as a team aligned around a single mission: to advance personal freedom for all (see ZK Credo).

To achieve this goal, we’re building zkSync — a credibly neutral, fully open source technology stack and network on top of Ethereum, which is owned and governed by its community. We use advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum infinitely without compromising on security or decentralization. With a world-class team, a community of over 1M supporters across Twitter + Discord, and hundreds of millions $ in funding, we have abundant resources to accomplish the mission.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead the product marketing function for Matter Labs by owning end-to-end GTM for ZKsync, covering messaging, competitive insights, sales enablement, and developer education. Produce technical content (white papers, tutorials, videos) and maintain a continuous feedback loop with pilots and the community. Establish and track key metrics to optimize campaigns and expand the ZKsync ecosystem.

What You Will Be Doing

Go-to-Market Strategy: Design and execute comprehensive GTM plans for ZKsync product and feature launches, covering messaging, outreach playbooks, developer education programs, and ecosystem partner coordination.Competitive & Market Insights: Conduct ongoing competitive analyses, market intelligence, and end-user research to inform product positioning, feature prioritization, and technical content strategy.Sales Enablement: Build and maintain up-to-date sales collateral: one-pagers, datasheets, verticalized slide decks (e.g., “Blockchain for Payments,” “Private Transactions for Institutions”), case studies, and competitor battle cards, so BD and sales teams can articulate value and close deals.Messaging & Positioning: Develop concise, differentiated product messaging tailored to each target segment (developers, enterprises, DeFi users), and ensure consistent technical messaging across all channels.Educational Resources: Lead creation of high-impact developer-focused content such as videos, tutorials, white papers, implementation guides, sample code repositories, and case studies that demonstrate ZKsync’s value proposition to technical decision-makers.Customer & Community Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize insights from pilots, early adopters, and developer communities, then channel them back into product and marketing priorities.Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key metrics such as developer sign-ups, integrations, MQLs, conversion rates, documentation usage, on-chain activity, churn, and community growth to measure marketing impact and continuously optimize campaigns.

What We Look For In You

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.

description.text:
Who You’ll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today’s most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design…).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men’s/Women’s Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You’ll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike’s position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

Start Date:ASAP
Location:Paris Hybrid (4-day in office, 1-day remote)

description.text:
👏 Si tu veux faire le grand saut, bravo, tu es au bon endroit 👏

👯‍♀️ Le mot d'Elisa, notre superbe business developer, recrutée grâce à sa candidature spontanée : 

"J'ai envoyé ma candidature spontanée à SMADE parce que je trouve l'entreprise super intéressante et que y travailler me motive vraiment. C'est sympa d'avoir cette possibilité, surtout lorsque les postes proposées ne me correspondaient pas totalement. Tout au long du processus de recrutement, j’ai vraiment senti que mon profil était pris au sérieux, et cela montre à quel point SMADE valorise tous ses candidats, peu importe comment ils ont postulé."

En résumé, que tu sois... développeur·se, ingénieur·e dans l'électronique, la mécanique ou le software embarqué, data analyst, product owner, business (wo)man, qualiticien·ne, que tu veuilles travailler avec nos clients, avec nos fournisseurs, avec les SMADERS en général.

Tu es le.la bienvenue ici !

Et il faut surtout que tu sois... une personne passionné·e par son job et par la vie de startup, par l'innovation et les nouvelles technologies, par les nouveaux challenges, que tu aies envie de rejoindre un projet entrepreneurial et le monde de la Medtech (même si tu n'y connais rien aujourd'hui).

Tu peux candidater ici ou directement sur l'offre qui t'intéresse 😊

PS: dans le cas où nous n'avons pas d'offre à te proposer, nous conservons ta candidature afin de te recontacter si une opportunité se présente !

Rien n'est perdu, tente ta chance 😉 

💜 QUI SOMMES-NOUS ? 

Les SMADERS, ce sont une équipe de passionnés, engagés dans un projet fou pour lequel nous sommes les pionniers du marché ! Ce sont des basketteurs, des danseurs, des très bons cuistots, des chefs barbecue, des fans d'ABBA, de Céline Dion, de Rock, de Métal, des dog lovers, des globe-trotteurs, des humoristes en devenir 🤩

Les SMADERS sont des artistes dans leur domaine. Découvre-les en cliquant ici 👇

🤞LA PROMESSE SMADE 

Un cadre de travail flexible et orienté sur des projets innovants et challengeants. Une opportunité de faire partie des piliers d'une startup d'innovation Medtech qui va révolutionner le marché de l'orthopédie. La chance de travailler avec une équipe de passionnés, artistes dans leur expertise ✨

🤝 LE PROCESS

Dans le désordre, tu pourras rencontrer :

 Noémie ou Marion dans le cadre d'un échange de découverte RH et fit culturel (échange d'une heure en visio)Le Lead du département correspondant à ton expertise, et un·e pair·e technique dans le cadre d'un ou deux échanges techniques avec un exercice de réflexion sur un thème donné en amont (échanges d'une heure dans nos locaux) David (Team Lead) qui assistera à la restitution de l'exercice mais avec qui tu auras également l'occasion d'échanger en one-to-one dans le cadre d'un entretien de fit culturel (échange d'une heure en visio ou dans nos locaux)

description.text:
OUR STORY:

🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.

Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.

📍 Our offices are located in Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.

At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.

All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.

basic_info.title: Un ou une responsable de projets numériques

description.text:
Rejoignez notre équipe de Transformation Numérique en tant que Responsable de Projets Numériques! Vous serez chargé ou chargée de piloter des produits numériques innovants pour la formation professionnelle, la santé, le social et l'orientation. Votre mission : faire vivre l'excellence numérique au service des usagers!#TransformationNumérique #EmploiPublique #ResponsableDeProjets #Numérique #Innovation #RégionIDF
Vos Missions: (télétravail partiel possible)Piloter des produits numériques de A à Z (conception, déploiement, maintenance)Assurer la maîtrise d'ouvrage et la coordination transverse entre équipesGérer les ressources financières et contractuellesAnimer la transformation numérique de la Région et collaborer avec divers pôles et partenaires
Votre profil :Expert ou experte des enjeux numériques et des domaines ciblés (formation, santé, social, orientation)Connaissances des procédures de marché publicConnaissances des outils numériques et bureautiquesExpérience confirmée en management de projets numériques et travail en équipeCapacité à innover, négocier et prendre des initiatives
Pourquoi nous rejoindre?En intégrant la Région Île-de-France, vous rejoindrez un employeur de premier plan, innovant et engagé dans des projets d’envergure pour l’amélioration de la vie des Franciliens. Vous travaillerez au sein de l’écoquartier moderne des Docks de Saint-Ouen, à proximité de Paris, dans un cadre de travail dynamique, incluant télétravail, open-spaces, espaces de restauration variés, et bien plus encore.Nos atouts : Flexibilité, confiance, autonomie, et une culture collaborative sont au cœur de nos valeurs. Rejoignez une équipe passionnée et contribuez à des projets qui font la différence !
Vous souhaitez développer vos talents et partager nos challenges ? Découvrez nos autres opportunités de postes et postulez en ligne : www.iledefrance.fr/recrute Toutes nos offres sont handi-accessibles.

Job Description

trying to find a good LLM approach to organize and summarize all the insights of 450 blog posts. it would be great if the solution organized the content into a new web page where the content was grouped/clustered by topic.

basically i cant read 400 blog posts but thinking if content is grouped into a new website easier to read it all

description.text:
We are looking for a Partner / CEO to help develop our mission and grow the company.
B3Data is a digital construction startup building an online platform to create and update 3D BIM models and securely store building data with AI support. Our goal: make construction and property management more efficient, sustainable, and accessible.
What You'll DoShape vision, strategy, and partnerships in construction and smart citiesSupport product growth and adoption of our platformBuild relationships with stakeholders across the industryAdvance our social mission: workforce inclusion through digital innovation
Who We're Looking ForWe welcome everyone — from motivated students to experienced professionals. What matters most is your drive to innovate and collaborate.Experience in BIM, CAD, AI, data, or business development is valuable.
Why join?Be part of a mission-driven startupBuild the future of digital construction and smart citiesWork in a flexible, inclusive, and impact-oriented environment
Interested? Reach out at contact@b3data.com

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients’ livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you’re interested in learning more please apply below!

description.text:
Are you ready to shape the future of leading events across Europe? Join one of the world’s Top-20 exhibition organisers and take the lead in driving growth across the French market.

At Easyfairs, we organize 110+ market-leading events across 16 countries, manage 8 venues across Europe, and have been recognized 7 years in a row as one of Best Managed Companies (Belgium) by Deloitte. We’re also proud recipients of “Great Place to Work” awards across all our key markets.

Your mission: 

As Growth & Strategy Manager France, you are responsible to grow Easyfairs’ presence in the French market. You’re directly shaping the region’s strategy by working closely with senior leadership and event teams across Europe. You’ll act as key player in identifying growth opportunities (new launches, geo-cloning of events, M&A and growth strategies for existing events) across diverse industries our events serve — from manufacturing, healthcare to education, entertainment and more.

Why join us?

Play a leading role in the expansion and transformation of an innovative events portfolio.Spearhead new market launches, directly shaping the region’s business strategy.Detect market trends and transform them in new growth opportunities for our current portfolio Collaborate with high-performing teams across Europe, driving initiatives with autonomy and creativity.Join a global leader in events, known for bringing business communities together and delivering exceptional results.


Key Responsibilities:

Identify launch opportunities on the French market, based on deep competitive scans and white-space analysis, deep industry value chain analysis, growth trends across industriesOwn the launch process of new events end-to-end: Market research, validation of potential with customers, negotiations with event venues, implementation together with local event teamsProvide structured advice on growth strategies for existing eventsContribute to budgeting and P&L planning of our French businessEnsure executive-level presentations to executive-level boards on new launch proposals and growth strategies are clear, data-driven, and high-impactSupport in the development of our French presence by networking with key external stakeholders (e.g., sector associations, exhibition venues, press, local governments, key exhibitors)


Stakeholder Management:

UKG Head of Business Development, Group Head of M&A, Head of Clusters, Head of sales, Head of Marketing and teams dedicated to the events.Regular relationship with other Business Development Team Members across the group. Engage with external stakeholders such as sector associations, federations, opinion leaders, press, key exhibitors. 


Requirements:

3-5 years’ experience in corporate strategy/growth roles or strategy/management consultingA master’s degree in a business/analytical discipline preferred Excellent analytical, oral and written communication skills. Capacity to summarise market insights into actionable strategiesSkilled in making strategic recommendations at management levelA growth and can-do mindset, high degree of curiosity and ambition, collaborative spirit, and international mindsetProven ability to manage multiple projects, engage stakeholders, and deliver results.Fluency in English and French mandatory, strong command of PowerPoint & Excel is key 


We offer:

A great role to grow into a regional or global leadership position, with real responsibility, visibility, regular mentoring & trainings. Competitive package including performance-based end-year bonus, enhanced family pay (maternity/paternity), pension contribution & life insurance, partial remote working and moreA dynamic, entrepreneurial and award-winning culture that cares about sustainability, diversity, inclusion and psychological safetyA varied and stimulating role, with exposure to many industries and tasks, regular travel to events and internal workshops, and a fun, international work environment


If you're excited about working for us and have the skills and experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply!

Who are we?

Easyfairs is a pan-European event company. We organise and host more than 200 events in 14 countries (Algeria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the United Kingdom) and we manage eight venues in Belgium, the Netherlands and Sweden. Our passion is to bring business communities and communities of interest together. We strive to “easify” the life of our customers and increase the return on their investment of time and money through all-in formulas, advanced technology and a customer-centric approach. The Easyfairs Group employs 750 highly committed talents. Our commitment to excellence has been recognised several times. We were named Belgium’s “Entrepreneur of the Year®” in 2018 and Deloitte has named us a “Best Managed Company” six years running (2019-24). The company is ranked 11th in the list of the world’s leading exhibition companies.

We understand that applicants can be put off applying for a job if they feel they don't fit all of the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills/ experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply! Here at Easyfairs, we are passionate about the power of fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment for our team to thrive in. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership – Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild— four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild’s global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild’s top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product — from market reports to custom research engagements — delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild’s offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities

description.text:
We’re looking for a Casino Manager for a fast-growing iGaming business. 
You'll be at the heart of the product, evaluating new game titles, curating the best mix for players, and constantly refining the content strategy through data and player behavior. Whether it’s reviewing game mechanics, analyzing hit rates, or testing themes, you’ll help define what great looks like in the casino lobby.
This is a role for someone who lives and breathes casino content — someone who wants to build structured, scalable processes while staying close to the games that make players come back.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing upcoming games and assessing their potential fit for our playersUsing data to spot trends, player favorites, and untapped opportunitiesCreating repeatable systems for content launches, tagging, and localizationWorking with Product to ensure content and features go hand in handBuilding relationships with providers to secure standout titles and exclusives
